bow: what is the one thing you re confident in as mother 22 and really really struggle with finding confidence in my parenting maybe it because feel like people expect me to fail despite being married which to some appears to matter to them just curious what something your confident is the right choice in parenting your kiddos mine is breastfeeding ve either being pregnant or breastfeeding little bit of both for while there the past consecutive years that the one thing that makes me feel like good mom what yours any tips on how to be more confident in your mothering skills know that my children know that no matter what love them unconditionally dedicated my little man has had rash for months and we ve tried everything we can think of to fix it including changing every product we use to fragrance and dye free option different lotions and creams and strict diet for me since he ebf still with only cheat days over the past months it expensive and difficult and losing too much weight but it working for my little guy so we ll get it figured out soon was able to breastfeed for an entire year even as migraine sufferer could take the meds normally would to treat the pain am proud was able to do that fyi am lacking in confidence just as much as you and 38 thought being an older mom would make things easier but it really does change the fact that nothing can adequately prepare you for motherhood when my month old is upset am confident in my ability to soothe him start with my voice then hold him and pat his back and he is usually calm within seconds my hugs and kisses he ll get them from me without having to ask have great connection with my son and that what keeps me confident as mother 21 and not married so know what you re feeling get lot of backlash from lot of angles from family about how should be raising him but when my son listens to me he makes eye contact before he does something he runs up to me with big smiles and buries his face into me when he shares just generally think he really great kid with such an awesome personality he let me know know doing it right my confidence lies in being able to read my kids can tell by their faces what they are thinking or what they need they are babies anymore so it has taken years and many freak outs to get here but compared to the way was when they were tiny am much more cool and collected now at least to most onlookers have too many insecurities to list here it would be text wall also it worth noting have third due in few months so know all this is going out the window soon deleted yup tried it thanks though oh man poor little fella and you that would be rough is he in disposable diapers maybe switch to cloth option my cousin would have rashes that spread from disposables they figured some common ingredient caused it also my oldest brother is also allergic to the cold he breaks out in hives and rash basically 10 months of the year we live in canada ve got this really great face cream ll bring you your face smells like peppermint your username made me laugh bahaha at first thought your username said regina great movie also 22 and completely feel where you re coming from often feel like people expect me to fail or are surprised when ca do some things some other moms families can do dropped out of hs and have no post secondary education stay at home mom whose only source of income is my measely baby bonus cheque aside from what my partner brings home in the eyes of some ve already failed ca go to single family function without hearing so when are you going to go back to work school do either if could afford childcare and working on finding work that can work with my so schedule so we wo need childcare right away we may not have much and we may live in small apartment but we manage just one thing am confident about is like you said is breastfeeding my son and have done so well together reaching almost 15 months with no sign of weaning it hard feeling like failure in front of some people but the truth is not everyone lifestyle is the same not everyone needs or wants to amount to six figure salary recently just had doctor blatantly ask me why did you have baby if you were going to prepare to go back to school and get decent education or put him in daycare was so offended did know how to answer him sorry for the wall of text have said any of this out loud before two babies here year old and month old and often wonder if doing everything to the best of my ability everyone else has their opinions about what is right for your child but none of that matters what best for your children is what you deem to be best for them you ll make mistakes along the way but if they are loved then they already have so much agreed proud of myself for sticking with breastfeeding until my son was which was just couple weeks ago it was easy and cried lot but did it also pretty damn confident in my ability of teaching him how to use words his father and do let him watch tv and we read him books everyday he was able to say and distinguish things by their name pretty early on suppose confident that my daughter will have good self image constantly tell her how beautiful intelligent creative and kind she is like seriously every chance get giving her some positive affirmation remember feeling highly inadequate as young as her age and do even know why determined that she ll never feel that way because of anything ve done if she fails at something let her know that she gave it her best shot and that we ca win everything also know how to make her laugh nobody can make her laugh like can think the key to becoming confident mother is to have lot of confidence in yourself and your abilities in general it is also important to realize you do know everything and that there is no reason you should know it all this is not bad thing through it seems like lot of new mothers feel like they are should be experts as soon as the baby makes his or her appearance if you are lucky you have lots of experienced mothers to ask for help they do know everything either but you could learn something from them and that good thing and should not make you feel insecure do what best for my son six months ago divorced his abusive father who told me was ruining our family and how selfish was being for taking our son even though gave him supervised visits all my family and friends came together and told me how much happier my son seemed and how had done then right thing every day see how happy he is and remember how we used to walk on eggshells sorry if got off topic all think about is my daughter want more for her than had stability affection no drugs or alcohol abuse in my house and support with school was never given chance to succeed and somehow my life turned out okay want to set her up so there no way she can fail sure she still might but at least will have tried hope when she turns 18 that she does try to escape like did my mother and had no relationship after moved out know my kids are eating right because an rd am not too strict but balance healthy meals with the occasional pizza or burger and think teaching good eating habits struggle with lot of other stuff but have this one taken care of hey listen being good mom is the most important job there is it does matter if you did finish school just turned 24 and found out was pregnant when was in college and had to temporarily quit or do have paying job am stay at home mama too think that raising your child the way that you want to is the most important thing putting child in daycare is the best option for everyone do worry what others think because you are doing what is best for you and your family you are certainly not failure and you have plenty of time when your baby grows up and is in school to do those things for yourself also congratulations for breastfeeding that long that is an incredible accomplishment that not many can say they have reached good luck in the future you sound like you are doing the right thing so do let them bring you down deleted 23 with year old and nearly month old baby confident that good mother am the best probably not human have my days but love my kids unconditionally and try my best even though married get lot of dirty looks seemingly from the old ladies do let it bother you who cares what other people think as long as you are doing whats right for you and yours that all that matters thank you this is so nice to hear read ideally would love to stay home with my boy as long as possible but it looking like going to have to look for something part time soon we do struggle sometimes and do want to have to worry about diapers or christmas coming up so something extra would be nice in the meantime and you re right do have lots of time to do those other things my son is still so young that genuinely feel like he is going to need me with him all the time for another while yet and okay with that do want to feel pressured to go into something and do want the added stress of one day was stay at home mom and the next my baby in full time daycare and in college university full time it may work for some but do think could handle it just yet it will be lot easier when he in school and know my family particularly my partner side would be happy hearing this but it just the truth they have really high expectations of their kids and they see me as one of their own my so youngest stepsister is 31 and just finally finished university straight out of highschool but her mom is still after her to do more know it comes from place of love and understand that they want their kids and grandkids to lead comfy wealthy lives who does but the pressure does help need to feel like success *now* and not feel like they think just lazy which ll admit can be of course do want to be broke and living in one bedroom for ever and we wo be but it working for right now have you tried bathing in oatmeal sounds weird but it helps my skin issues deleted breastfeeding is easy and it is hard that ca pawn it off to my husband at times but am proud that my month old son has had nothing but breastmilk since he was born even when had thrush in my ducts and it felt like razor blades when he fed can do this my sons are bit older than the rest of the thread they re 11 and ve found my confidence has grown right there along with them right now confident that ve been doing good job these past 11 years both my sons have had their school teachers proactively reach out to tell me how much they enjoy them in class it so lovely to hear to know other adults and educators delight in them almost as much as do on the flip side of that something find myself thinking is why did have baby if was just going to go back to work and have other people care for him think we re both just insecure and many onlookers are too outspoken jealous that you are staying home with your babe think you re doing good thing ooh that is one we have tried ll bring it up with my husband and our doctor asap thanks like to think feeding my son properly but ve caught lot of gruff for it from literally everyone we encounter at 18mo ve had people ask if he could have soda amp and coffee yes coffee somehow am being unreasonable when say no also enforce rule that if you re going to put food in my sons facehole you must ask me about it first as he seems to be developing allergies but *i m* the asshole aveeno has an oatmeal body wash soap got mine at target that my child will never have to go through the terrible fucked up childhood like my husband had to go through have heard about disposable diapers causing rash over the entire body but ll look into it we also think it might have something to do with heat we re experimenting with how cool his bath water can go and trying new pjs tonight thanks confident that she is getting the best nutrition possible breastfeed she almost year old and any solid foods she eats is organic with the rare taste of piece of food ll be eating know she is very healthy and my husband and are doing the right thing regarding nutrition not downing anyone else and how they feed their kid this is just our method to each their own 28 with two grew up in broken home without lot of stability even as kid knew we were poor worked three jobs while was pregnant with my second son and am still working two this allows my husband to stay home during the day work my second job at night while the kids are sleeping so do miss too much time with them do spoil my kids with too many toys or material goods but the extra money means that they can participate in things they like that are good for them like camps and martial arts we re able to take at least two family vacations year and if we want to go out to eat or see movie do have to stress about the money too much being able to provide for my family makes me feel like good mom also 22 and have been pregnant or breastfeeding sometimes both for three years confident in how teach my kids about positive attitudes and happiness have two happy confident kids because support and respect them am confident in knowing my ultimate goal for parenting making sure that my son knows he is safe and unconditionally loved this is what set my sight on when do know what to do or which potty training method to use or how much tv to let him watch as long as he feels safe and loved feel like he ll be ok in the long run am also proud of breastfeeding both my children glad that was able to do so with both kids to be confident in your mothering skills you need to know that these are your children not someone else children who cares what anyone else thinks the best mom can be to them when have an outlet for problem solving through work breastfeeding and they are polite and smart and an oatmeal lotion it amazing so sorry sure you have but in case have you tried the aveeno diaper rash stuff it is the only thing that helped when my babe got bad rash for few weeks good luck mama had someone offer my month old carrot just to chew on and then look at me like was nuts for saying no just because he has teeth does mean he can eat carrot and just because feed him steamed carrot mush does mean it the same thing as raw carrot people are dumb and of course those same people criticize me for giving him greek yogurt which he loves and makes for magical bms that we stick to our guns about how we want to raise our children even if it flys in the face of how our friends and family members are raising their children to us the no juice no tv concept is pretty straightforward but we get so much shit over it confident that my kiddo is benefitting from continuining to breastfeed and confident that getting her all the recommended vaccinations is the right choice other things that make me feel like good mom are how much kiddo likes her vegetables when she goes to pick stuff off my plate she goes for veggies first and how friendly she is in public she getting lot better at saying hi and bye when we ask her to and doing so without being prompted as well know people appreciate that she interacts with them instead of hiding behind my skirt well jeans it not just diaper rash it all over the rash is actually gone from the diaper area it mostly his tummy and back thanks anyway oh no is it baby eczema oy if that is it well even if it is my heart goes out to you and baby my girl had it for the longest time for us dairy seemed to be the culprit now at 16 mo and still bf ing she can have some and so can but she will still get little rashy every now and then even though quitting dairy helped it did totally fix it it is so difficult to figure out these allergies constantly second guess myself fed her mac cheese for lunch oh god teaching her horrible eating habits let her go an extra day without bath she going to have horrible hygiene do take her to the park every day she not getting enough exercise do do playdates as often as like she going to be antisocial but then look at her she so smart she picks up on the funniest things out in public she catches people attentions and can charm the whole lot of them if given fruits and veggies she ll eat them although she picky about *how* her veggies are prepared bath time is fun time to splash the water and play with the water toys and then bedtime with stories she great kid so obviously doing *something* right take comfort in the fact that she is happy and that ve been able to keep her safe and healthy it started when was still pregnant was confident that could birth without medication and did and it was very positive experience confident that breastfeeding my daughter for years was the best thing could have done and was confident though sad when weaned her confident that am feeding her the right foods am confident that cloth diapering her was the best decision for her and for our family and was also confident in my decision to switch to disposables when it became necessary confident that she in the right daycare and confident in my decision to go back to work full time could probably make list just as long about all the things not confident in but think it all boils down to the fact that love my daughter and trying my best also try an anti fungal our doc just had us use lotrimin my little guy used to get fungal diaper rashes that would not respond to anything else my baby is just nine days old so still only just figuring out this mothering gig but pretty proud that we ve got this breastfeeding business down to fine art my baby is cute as fuck my ped suggested giving my month old cold raw carrot to gnaw on when he teething have done it because it just seems wrong but she said she does it with her kids here is what tell all the moms that work with find confidence in the fact that there are so many opinions out there for many mothers knowing that you can read 10 books and get 10 different expert opinions is frustrating and daunting and makes them feel like there no way to know if they are making the right choices my advice is to look at it the other way if the experts can all have different thoughts and can all still be considered experts then there are endless acceptable choices you can make in other words whatever choices feel right for you are right for you and there will always be someone who disagrees because that how it is also one other thing to consider no choice you make is set in stone if you make parenting decision and you realize it is working for you do be afraid to revisit it and make different choice do think any other mother out there had all the answers on the first try my husband gave him whole carrot once when was looking in less than minute he had bitten off choking hazard sized chunk and we were fishing it out of his mouth lots of old school moms have suggested carrots for teething but what to do when they bite off piece figure if he can not possibly chew it and it can be broken into small pieces he probably should have it in his mouth thank you printing this out to put on my fridge and read everyday it might be eczema lot of my husbands family has it is there any way of fixing that or will he have it for the rest of his life well my daughter had it pretty bad on her face and arms and the back of her legs it was such pain in the butt to figure out and in the meantime felt so bad for her would take week at time and do elimination with dairy eliminated it seemed to help the most but it did totally clear up but for the last couple months she is 16 months it has mostly gone away few spots on her chin every so often and that is with us both eating dairy was told she would probably grow out of it so prayed she would from what understand most kids do there is that cerecil sp stuff that lot of people use but as someone with adult eczema that worried me so chemically so used this burts bees wonderful cream and it helped her but did heal it so from what unsderstand he will likely grow out of it and you may be able to try an elimination diet for both of you to see if it helps and you can start from dairy there is chance he can have it for life but hopefully and most likely he will grow out of it hope that is somewhat helpful best of luck the crazy diet mentioned in my first post in this thread is full elimination diet ve cut out eggs wheat gluten dairy soy nightshade and citrus all at once the plan was to add one thing back at time to shorten the diet but it been almost two months and the rash came back last week so we re just going to see what the doctor says at his 6month appointment next week positive thoughts our way would be appreciated thanks for your concern mommas you know change of season may be aggravating it it might calm back down again soon especially if are still eliminating diet sending love think you re onto something with the at least doing one thing right approach life is filled with opportunities to doubt yourself or beat yourself up my son is teen now and the parenting challenges remain they re just different than the baby toddler ones find that whenever my life is getting too chaotic and feel like not doing right by my family can get to better place by focusing on one thing like okay the kitchen is messy laundry is piling up the closets need reorganized the basement is wreck we re eating out too much but am going to pick one thing to do better ll make dinner nights this week or ll get all the socks matched ll bake some healthy muffins and then ve got that one thing to point to to internally say well at least you re doing that right it enough most of the time to keep me from despair ugh if that was my doctor would ve gone apeshit another thing believe me you could ve done all the stuff and people will still judge you 25 with college degree and had solid years of career stuff burned out and went overseas came back and was pregnant at 24 an acquaintance who had just had her baby in her 40s had the nerve to say to me well at least you decided to keep it yeah did thanks also people *still* ask me when going to work grad school back overseas my husband who is the same age earns great salary and is self employed you can really have it all and people will still judge you because of your age pisses me off but hey whatever there are lots of little things but the one that gets the most amount of comments from strangers is have conversations with my 15month old and have ever since she was born ask her what she wants to wear what she wants to eat how she likes the flowers etc etc she does always get what she wants to wear or eat but try to empower her to think like an individual about things that affect her life my basic tip is see if your child ren is are happy healthy learning etc if they are then something is going right look at what you do on daily or weekly basis and see how you feel while you do it playing with your children taking care of yourself and taking care of your family although broad categories show how you mother another big thing for me is to learn which naysayers are just being jealous over controlling and which ones are actually looking out for our family my mil is jealous over controlling person who will take many opportunities to cut down both my and my husband parenting styles her mom is trying to look out for us but they both are abrasive in their communication
